comments.body: Please still echo the symbols that were searched as a breadcrumb to developers.

By removing the brackets in the `if` statement it outputs all the matches now. I removed printing the symbols since I thought the matches were more useful, but if you still think we should have both I'll add it back.
I think developers will only care about what symbols have been found, the `nm` grep is pretty gritty.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@# b/c hyperkube binds everything simply check that for bad symbols
if nm ${KUBE_OUTPUT_HOSTBIN}/hyperkube | grep "${PATTERN}"; then
  echo "output binaries contain bad symbols"
  exit 1
fi

comments.body: Won't this match the string "testing."? I can imagine legit ways that could be included. Is there an easy way to make this more specific? If not, disregard.

We can always mock in the future if it triggers false positives.  That symbol was the culprit that included the testing dependencies.  So I'm inclined to say update as needed, and it could be a long regex for future needs.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +25,29 @@
# add other BADSYMBOLS here.
BADSYMBOLS="testing[.]"

# b/c hyperkube binds everything simply check that for bad symbols
